item.description: intro! and what this post aims to do This is a hand hold-y article.

item.title: The Joy of Cognitive Dissonance
item.description: “Well, all information looks like noise until you break the code.” - Neal Stephenson A mentor described “Cognitive Dissonance” to me as the feeling our brains get when something in our environment doesn’t fit in with our model of how the world usually operates.

item.title: master as the needle - blog series
item.description: intro and motivation I don’t feel accomplished when I vibe code, “he who does the work gets the learning” and if I outsource all / most of it then I’m not actually becoming a more capable person when I have Claude write all my code, and I think that’s not good.

item.title: understanding sprint - morphisms
item.description: Purpose of this document I’ve seen the root “morph” around quite a bit and it has scared me and as all good parties go, last night I was insctructed in the ways of homomorphic encryption and when looking at the wikipdia page I traced back to morphisms and thought it looked too fun to pass up.
